Despite the various opinions, the couple remains focused on their love for each other and the life they plan to build together.

Summary: Governor Hermilando 'Dodo' Mandanas, 80 years old, married his 32-year old lawyer girlfriend in a ceremony attended by close friends and family members. The age difference between the couple has raised some eyebrows, but they are committed to their relationship and the new chapter in their lives.

Ikinasal na ang 80-anyos na si Batangas Governor Hermilando 'Dodo" Mandanas at ang 32-anyos niyang nobya na isang abogada.

item.title: 60 OFWs na mula sa Israel, dumating na sa Pilipinas
item.content:encoded:
Overseas Filipino workers, Israel, Department of Migrant Workers, 60, arrived Summary: 60 overseas Filipino workers arrived in the Philippines from Israel with the assistance of the Department of Migrant Workers. The workers sought help to return home amid the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic. The Department facilitated their repatriation by coordinating with relevant authorities. The successful return of these OFWs highlights the ongoing efforts to assist Filipino workers abroad in times of need. It underscores the importance of collaboration between government agencies and overseas Filipinos' organizations in ensuring the welfare and protection of OFWs. The Department's dedication to supporting and serving Filipino migrant workers remains steadfast as they continue to provide assistance and guidance to those seeking to come back to their home country. This repatriation effort signifies a commitment to upholding the rights and well-being of overseas Filipino workers amidst difficult circumstances.

Summary:

Dumating nitong Huwebes sa Pilipinas mula sa Israel ang 60 overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) matapos magpatulong na makauwi, ayon sa Department of Migrant Workers (DMW).

item.title: Pinoy, kasama sa 7 crew ng Portuguese ship na pinalaya ng Iran
item.content:encoded:
ship, Portuguese-flagged, Iran, Pinoy, crew Summary: Iran released 25 crew members of a Portuguese-flagged ship near the Strait of Hormuz in April. Among those released was a Filipino crew member. The incident occurred when the ship was intercepted by Iranian forces, leading to the seizure of the crew and the ship. The crew members were reportedly detained for several days before being released. The Portuguese government and relevant authorities worked tirelessly to secure the release of the crew members, ensuring their safe return. The incident highlights the tensions in the region and the challenges faced by international vessels navigating through the area. The release of the crew members, including the Filipino individual, brings relief and marks a positive development in the resolution of the situation.

Summary:

Pito sa 25 crew ng Portuguese-flagged ship na kinubkob ng Iran malapit sa Strait of Hormuz noong Abril ang pinakawalan ng Iran. Kabilang sa mga pinakawalan ang isang Pinoy.

item.title: Beach sa Basilan, pang-world class ang ganda
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Basilan, beach, sand, clear water, peaceful Summary: Basilan, a province in Mindanao known for its history of violence, now offers a peaceful retreat with its pristine beaches. The sand on these beaches is fine and pure, making it a perfect spot for relaxation. The clear water allows for perfect reflections and an opportunity to see the beauty beneath the surface. Despite its tumultuous past, Basilan now boasts a calm and serene environment, making it an ideal destination for those seeking tranquility. Whether lounging on the shore or taking a refreshing dip in the sea, visitors to Basilan can immerse themselves in the beauty of nature and enjoy a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life.

Summary:

Puti at pino ang buhangin, at sa linaw ng tubig ay puwedeng manalamin. Ang beach na ito, matatagpuan sa isang lalawigan sa Mindanao na dating kilala sa karahasan pero tahimik na umano ngayon-- ang Basilan.

item.title: LTO urges public to report 'wang-wang' use on hotline
item.content:encoded:
encouraging, public, report, government vehicles, hotline Summary:
The Land Transportation Office is encouraging the public to report government vehicles and personnel using sirens or wang-wang, blinkers, and similar flashing devices. They can do so through the hotline 0929-292-0865. It is important to ensure that government vehicles and personnel follow the regulations regarding the use of such devices to maintain safety on the roads. Reporting any misuse or abuse of these devices can help in keeping the roads safe for all motorists and pedestrians. The hotline provided by the Land Transportation Office allows individuals to easily report any violations they observe, contributing to the enforcement of proper use of sirens and flashing lights in government vehicles. Such initiatives aim to promote accountability and responsibility among government personnel when it comes to road safety measures. It is a collective effort to uphold the rules and regulations for the benefit of the general public.

Summary:

The Land Transportation Office is encouraging the public to report government vehicles and personnel using sirens or wang-wang, blinkers, and similar flashing devices through its hotline 0929-292-0865.

item.title: Six barangay officials in Abra suspended over threatening penalty for waste disposal
item.content:encoded:
Barangay Captain, officials, Barangay Calaba, Bangued, Abra

The Barangay Captain and five officials of Barangay Calaba in Bangued, Abra, were suspended for implementing a controversial sanction against violators of improper waste disposal. The officials faced suspension due to their actions related to the penalties imposed on individuals who violated waste disposal regulations in the barangay. The suspensions were a result of a thorough investigation into the matter, highlighting the importance of proper governance and adherence to rules and regulations. The controversy surrounding the sanctions underscores the challenges faced by local officials in enforcing environmental laws effectively. The suspensions serve as a reminder of the accountability and responsibility that public officials hold in upholding community standards and promoting environmental conservation efforts. The case in Barangay Calaba sheds light on the significance of proper waste management practices and the need for transparent and fair enforcement mechanisms within local government units.

Summary: The Barangay Captain and officials of Barangay Calaba in Bangued, Abra, were suspended for implementing a controversial waste disposal sanction, emphasizing the importance of governance and adherence to rules.

The barangay captain and five other officials of Barangay Calaba in Bangued, Abra were suspended over a controversial sanction for the violators of improper waste disposal.

item.title: Soldiers' supplies airdropped on Patag Island for Balikatan 2024
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Air Force, airdrop drills, military troops, Patag Island, Balikatan exercises Summary: The Philippine Air Force conducted airdrop drills for military troops stationed at Patag Island in the West Philippine Sea as part of the 2024 Balikatan exercises. The drills were aimed at enhancing the troops' readiness and capabilities in conducting airdrop missions in maritime environments. The exercises took place in the context of the ongoing territorial disputes in the region, highlighting the importance of maintaining a strong military presence in the West Philippine Sea. The drills were part of the larger Balikatan exercises, which involve joint military operations between the Philippines and the United States. The training provided valuable experience for both the Philippine Air Force and the military troops involved, showcasing their readiness to respond to any potential threats in the region.

Summary:

item.title: Plane skids off runway in Senegal, injuring at least 10
item.content:encoded:
Passengers, Skidded, Runway, Injured, Senegal
Summary:
A plane carrying dozens of passengers skidded off a runway at Senegal's main airport, injuring at least 10 people. The incident led to a temporary halt at the facility. The plane was preparing for takeoff when the accident occurred, causing confusion and panic among the passengers. Emergency services were deployed to the scene to assist the injured individuals and assess the situation. The exact cause of the skid remains unknown, raising concerns about the safety protocols in place at the airport. Authorities are investigating the incident to determine the factors that led to the runway mishap and prevent similar accidents in the future.

A plane with dozens of passengers skidded off a runway before takeoff at Senegal's main airport on Thursday, injuring at least 10 people and bringing the facility temporarily to a halt.

item.title: Israeli forces mass on Rafah"s outskirts; US warns a major assault could halt arms
item.content:encoded:
Israel, forces, tanks, fire, Rafah Israeli forces, including tanks, opened fire near built-up areas in Rafah following a statement by US President Joe Biden, who threatened to withhold weapons if Israel launched a major invasion. The Israeli forces massed tanks and escalated tensions in the region, prompting concerns about a potential large-scale conflict. Biden's warning signaled a shift in US-Israel relations, as previous administrations have provided unwavering support to Israel. The decision to withhold weapons underscored growing international pressure on Israel to de-escalate the situation and seek a peaceful resolution. The situation in Rafah remained tense as Israeli forces continued their show of force, raising fears of further violence and instability in the region.

Summary:

Israeli forces massed tanks and opened fire close to built-up areas of Rafah after US President Joe Biden vowed to withhold weapons from Israel if its forces launch a major invasion.

item.title: Alleged gang war kills 1, hurts 2 in Liloan, Cebu
item.content:encoded:
shooting incident, Liloan town, gang war, motive, police

The Liloan Police in north Cebu Province are investigating a shooting incident in Liloan town, with a possible gang war being looked into as a motive. The police have identified the incident as potentially being linked to gang-related violence in the area. They are working to gather more information and evidence to determine the exact cause of the shooting. The authorities are urging the public to come forward with any information that may assist in the investigation. As tensions rise in the community, the police are increasing their presence to prevent further violence and ensure the safety of residents. The situation is being closely monitored, and efforts are being made to maintain peace and order in the town amidst the ongoing gang conflict.

Summary: The Liloan Police are investigating a shooting incident in Liloan town, with a possible gang war being considered as a motive. The incident is believed to be related to gang-related violence in the area, prompting authorities to take measures to ensure public safety and prevent further escalation of conflicts.

Gang war is looked into as a motive in a shooting incident in Liloan town, north Cebu Province, according to the Liloan Police.

item.title: Nancy Binay mulls running for Makati mayor in 2025
item.content:encoded:
Senator Nancy Binay, Makati City mayor, 2025 elections, brother-in-law Summary: Senator Nancy Binay is considering running for Makati City mayor in the 2025 elections. She may potentially go up against her brother-in-law in the mayoral race. Binay's decision to enter the mayoral race signals a potential family rivalry in the upcoming elections. The possibility of a political showdown between relatives adds an interesting twist to the electoral landscape in Makati City. Binay's entry into the mayoral race could create a dynamic and competitive environment for voters in the city.

Senator Nancy Binay said she is considering a run for Makati City mayor in the 2025 elections, and addressed the possibility that she might go up against her brother-in-law if she does so.

item.title: PH tightens visa issuance for Chinese tourists amid fraud
item.content:encoded: The Philippines will tighten its visa requirements for Chinese tourists amid a high number of fraudulent applications received in its embassy and consulates in China.

item.title: Driver ng nakaw na luxury car sa LA, tila naglaho nang tumilapon matapos bumangga sa center island
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: driver, luxury car, Los Angeles, police chase, disappearance Summary: The driver of a stolen luxury car disappeared after crashing into a center island while being pursued by the police in Los Angeles, California. The incident left authorities baffled as the driver vanished into thin air following the crash. The stolen vehicle was reportedly speeding during the chase, putting both the driver and the public at risk. Despite law enforcement's efforts to track down the driver, they were left with no leads due to the mysterious disappearance. The sudden turn of events raised questions about the driver's motives and how they managed to escape the scene without a trace. The police continue to investigate the case in an attempt to locate the missing individual and hold them accountable for their actions.

Summary: The driver of a stolen luxury car in Los Angeles vanished after crashing into a center island, sparking a police chase. Authorities were left puzzled by the driver's mysterious disappearance, which occurred right after the collision. The reckless behavior of the driver endangered both themselves and the public during the high-speed pursuit. Despite efforts to locate the driver, law enforcement was unable to find any leads, leaving questions about the individual's motives and escape strategy. The sudden turn of events has prompted a thorough investigation into the case to apprehend the driver and uncover the circumstances surrounding their disappearance.

Tila biglang naglaho ang driver matapos siyang tumilapon nang bumangga sa center island ang minamaneho niyang nakaw na luxury car na hinahabol ng pulisya sa Los Angeles, California.

item.title: Marcos urges Zamboanga, neighboring towns to prepare for rainy season
item.content:encoded:
Prepare, local government, Zamboanga, rainy season, climate change Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. is urging the local government of Zamboanga and neighboring areas to prepare for the upcoming rainy season. He emphasized the importance of being ready for extreme weather conditions brought upon by climate change. Marcos Jr. highlighted the need for proactive measures to minimize the potential impact of severe weather events on the region. He stressed the significance of early planning and preparedness to ensure the safety and well-being of the communities in Zamboanga and nearby areas. As the country continues to face unpredictable weather patterns, Marcos Jr. called for a coordinated effort among local officials and residents to mitigate the risks associated with the changing climate.

Summary:

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Thursday called on the local government of Zamboanga and neighboring areas to prepare for the rainy season, saying that the country is experiencing extreme weather due to climate change.

item.title: Cop who drove PNP van in EDSA busway relieved for violation
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: policeman, Philippine National Police, van, EDSA busway, relieved Summary: A policeman, who was assigned to drive a Philippine National Police van, has been relieved of his duties after using the EDSA busway without authorization. The incident occurred when the officer was caught driving the police van on a lane reserved for buses on EDSA. The Philippine National Police took immediate action by relieving the officer from his duties, emphasizing the importance of following traffic rules and regulations. The violation of using the busway without permission not only reflects poorly on the individual officer but also on the entire police force. This incident serves as a reminder for all law enforcement personnel to adhere to the laws they are tasked with enforcing, setting a good example for the general public. The PNP's swift response to the unauthorized use of the EDSA busway demonstrates their commitment to upholding the law and maintaining discipline within their ranks.

Summary:

The policeman assigned to drive a Philippine National Police van who was unauthorized to use the EDSA busway has been relieved, according to the PNP.

item.title: Marijuana worth P862M destroyed in Kalinga -- PNP
item.content:encoded: Authorities destroyed a total of nearly P862 million worth of marijuana in their nine-day operation in Kalinga, according to the Philippine National Police (PNP).

item.title: Putin warns of global clash as Russia marks World War II victory
item.content:encoded: Russia President Vladimir Putin on Thursday accused the West of risking a global conflict and said no one would be allowed to threaten the world's biggest nuclear power.

item.title: Marcos ICC stance remains consistent, briefer not a change in position
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s stance on the International Criminal Court (ICC) remains consistent, Presidential Communications Office Secretary Cheloy Garafil said on Thursday.

item.title: Marcos: Over 3K hectares of farmlands damaged due to El Niño in Zamboanga
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. said Thursday that more than 3,000 hectares of farmlands have been damaged due to the El Niño phenomenon.

item.title: Angara: Cha-cha panel report expected after SONA
item.content:encoded:
Senate subcommittee, constitutional amendments, revision of codes, Resolution on Both Houses (RBH) No. 6, report
Summary:
Senator Sonny Angara stated that the report on Resolution on Both Houses (RBH) No. 6 by the Senate subcommittee on constitutional amendments and revision of codes is anticipated to be released after the sine die break of Congress. This report is significant for understanding the proposed changes to the constitution and legal codes. The subcommittee's findings and recommendations are eagerly awaited by the public and policymakers. The outcome of this report will impact discussions and decisions on constitutional amendments and revisions in the future. Senator Angara's announcement suggests that the subcommittee has made progress in reviewing RBH No. 6 and is nearing the completion of their assessment. The report's release after the sine die break indicates that it will be a focus of attention when Congress reconvenes. Overall, the report's publication will provide valuable insights into potential changes to the country's fundamental laws and legal frameworks.

The report of the Senate subcommittee on constitutional amendments and revision of codes on Resolution on Both Houses (RBH) No. 6 is expected to be out after Congress' sine die break, Senator Sonny Angara said.

item.title: Thai PM calls for illegal drugs crackdown
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Thai Prime Minister, crack down, illegal drugs, recriminalize cannabis, punishment
Summary: Thai Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin has taken a strong stance against illegal drugs, emphasizing that even possessing a single pill should carry consequences. He has instructed officials to intensify efforts to combat drug trafficking and usage in the country. Additionally, the Prime Minister has ordered for the recriminalization of cannabis, signaling a shift in drug policy in Thailand. The crackdown on illegal substances is expected to be rigorous and stringent under the leadership of Thavisin. In light of these new directives, authorities are likely to increase enforcement measures and penalties for drug-related offenses in the nation.

Summary:

BANGKOK, Thailand - Thai Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin has vowed to crack down on illegal drugs, saying that possessing "even one pill" should be punished, and ordering officials to press ahead with plans to recriminalize cannabis.

item.title: Higanteng monitor lizard, nahuling 'minumukbang" ang malaking sawa sa isang garden
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: monitor lizard, sawa, mukbang, witnesses, caught Summary: Witnesses were amazed at the sight of a large monitor lizard engaging in a mukbang session with a sizable python it had caught. The unusual event unfolded before the astonished onlookers who were shocked to see the monitor lizard consuming the python in such a public display. The incident drew attention due to the unusual feeding behavior of the monitor lizard, which is not commonly seen consuming such large prey. The witnesses could not believe their eyes as they watched the monitor lizard's voracious appetite in action, showcasing the power and adaptability of these fascinating reptiles in the wild. The unique encounter left a lasting impression on those present, offering a rare glimpse into the predator-prey dynamics of the natural world. The event served as a reminder of the diverse and intriguing behaviors exhibited by wildlife, highlighting the complex interactions that shape ecosystems.

Summary:

Ikinamangha ng mga saksi ang ginawang pag-“mukbang” ng isang higanteng monitor lizard sa nahuli nitong malaking sawa.

item.title: Postponement of next BSKE sought despite SC ruling
item.content:encoded: A bill has been filed at the House of Representatives seeking to postpone the December 2025 Barangay and Sangguniang Kabataan elections despite a Supreme Court ruling that such postponement is illegal.

item.title: Ombudsman affirms order to file graft raps vs. Lao, ex-DBM, Pharmally execs
item.content:encoded: The Office of the Ombudsman affirmed its 2023 decision ordering the filing of multiple graft charges against former Budget Undersecretary Christopher Liao, Pharmally officials, and others over the alleged anomalous procurement of P4 billion worth of RT-PCR COVID-19 test kits.

item.title: PhilHealth increases breast cancer benefit to P1.4 million
item.content:encoded: Breast cancer patients may now avail of up to P1.4 million worth of benefit for treatment from PhilHealth.

item.title: Bato on alleged Marcos, Soriano drug use: Just plain info, far from truth
item.content:encoded: Senator Dela Rosa says the alleged involvement of President Marcos and actress Maricel Soriano in illegal drugs is just "plain information" and still "far from the truth."

item.title: Dingdong Dantes, muling nag-renew ng kontrata sa Kapuso Network
item.content:encoded:
signing, contract, GMA Network, Dingdong Dantes, solid Kapuso Summary: Dingdong Dantes reaffirmed his loyalty to the GMA Network by signing a new contract on Thursday. This move solidifies his status as a solid Kapuso, showing his continued commitment to the network where he has been a long-time member. This new agreement demonstrates the strong bond between Dantes and the network, highlighting their successful collaboration over the years. By renewing his contract, Dantes has secured his future projects and continued partnership with GMA, ensuring that he will continue to be a prominent figure in the Kapuso community. His decision to remain with the network reflects his trust and confidence in their support and his dedication to providing quality entertainment to viewers.

Sinelyuhan ni Dingdong Dantes ang kaniyang pagiging solid Kapuso sa kaniyang pagpirma ng bagong kontrata sa GMA Network nitong Huwebes.

item.title: Higanteng halo-halo, pinagsaluhan sa pista sa Estancia, Iloilo
item.content:encoded:
Halo-halo Festival, Estancia, Iloilo, residents, visitors Summary: Residents and visitors come together annually to partake in a massive halo-halo at the Halo-halo Festival in Estancia, Iloilo. The event showcases the community's love for this popular Filipino dessert, blending shaved ice with a variety of ingredients such as fruits, sweet beans, nata de coco, and more. The festival not only celebrates the unique flavors and textures of halo-halo but also promotes camaraderie among attendees. It serves as a platform for people to bond and enjoy the delicious treat together. The event attracts a diverse crowd, including locals and tourists alike, who gather to indulge in this refreshing dessert under the warm sun of Iloilo. Overall, the Halo-halo Festival in Estancia, Iloilo, is a vibrant celebration of Filipino culture, unity, and culinary delights.

Pinagsaluhan ng mga residente at bisita ang isang higanteng halo-halo sa taunang Halo-halo Festival sa Estancia, Iloilo.

item.title: Catapang baffled by complaint vs. NBP strip search, says wives visited before
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Bureau of Corrections, strip searches, wives, persons deprived of liberty, New Bilibid Prison Summary: Bureau of Corrections Director General Gregorio Catapang Jr. expressed confusion over the complaint filed by wives of persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) and political prisoners about strip searches at the New Bilibid Prison (NBP). He mentioned that the complainants had visited the prison multiple times before, raising questions about their sudden objection to the searches. Catapang Jr. acknowledged the importance of addressing the concerns raised by the complainants but emphasized the necessity of security protocols in correctional facilities such as the NBP. The issue of strip searches at the NBP has sparked debate and criticism, with advocates calling for more humane treatment of visitors and increased transparency in prison procedures. The wives of PDLs and political prisoners have raised their voices against what they perceive as degrading and invasive practices, urging authorities to reconsider their approach to security measures at the prison.

Summary:

Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) Director General Gregorio Catapang Jr. said Thursday he was puzzled by the complaint filed by wives of persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) and political prisoners regarding the strip searches they experienced at the New Bilibid Prison (NBP), saying the complainants had visited numerous times before.

item.title: Tricycle driver, patay nang pagbabarilin sa Malabon City
item.content:encoded: Nasawi ang isang tricycle driver matapos pagbabarilin ng mga hindi pa nakikilalang salarin sa Barangay Hulong Duhat, Malabon City.

item.title: Marcos ensures funding for 100M coconut tree planting project
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Marcos Jr., funding, Philippine Coconut Authority, project, coconut trees Summary: President Marcos Jr. took steps to ensure adequate funding for the Philippine Coconut Authority's initiative to plant 100 million coconut trees. By allocating sufficient resources to the project, Marcos Jr. demonstrated his commitment to the coconut industry and agricultural development in the Philippines. The project's ambitious goal of planting a significant number of coconut trees aligns with efforts to enhance the country's agricultural productivity and boost the economy. With increased coconut production, the Philippines can further solidify its position as a leading exporter of coconut products in the global market. Marcos Jr.'s support for the project reflects the government's focus on promoting sustainable agriculture and harnessing the potential of the coconut industry to drive growth and prosperity for the nation.

Summary:

President Marcos Jr. ensured that there would be sufficient funding for the Philippine Coconut Authority's project to plant 100 million coconut trees

item.title: Lalaki sa QC, huli matapos paulit-ulit umanong gahasain ang sariling anak
item.content:encoded:
Father, Quezon City, imprisonment, sexual assault, daughter
Summary: A father in Quezon City has been imprisoned after allegedly sexually assaulting his 14-year-old daughter repeatedly since 2022. The man was arrested and placed in custody following reports of the ongoing abuse. The victim, the man's daughter, was said to have endured the assaults for a significant period of time before eventually seeking help. Authorities intervened and conducted an investigation into the matter, leading to the father's arrest and legal consequences. The traumatic experience has undoubtedly left a lasting impact on the young girl, emphasizing the importance of addressing and preventing such cases of abuse within familial settings. The father's arrest serves as a reminder of the pervasive issue of sexual assault and the significance of holding perpetrators accountable for their actions.

Sa kulungan ang bagsak ng isang ama sa Quezon City matapos umanong paulit-ulit na gahasain ang 14-anyos niyang anak mula pa noong 2022.

item.title: Marcos should endorse SC decision vs. red-tagging -- Human Rights Watch
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., endorse, Supreme Court ruling, red-tagging, Human Rights Watch (HRW) Summary:

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is urged by the Human Rights Watch (HRW) to publicly support the Supreme Court ruling that red-tagging poses a threat to a person's life, liberty, or security. The HRW emphasized the importance of endorsing this decision to protect individuals from unjust accusations and potential harm. This call comes in light of the widespread practice of red-tagging in the Philippines, which has led to violations of human rights and targeted attacks on activists, journalists, and dissenters. By publicly embracing the Supreme Court's ruling, President Marcos Jr. can signal his commitment to upholding the rule of law and safeguarding the rights and well-being of all citizens. It is hoped that this endorsement will contribute to a more secure and just society where individuals are able to exercise their rights and freedoms without fear of reprisal or persecution.

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. should publicly endorse the Supreme Court ruling that red-tagging is a threat to a person"s life, liberty, or security, the Human Rights Watch (HRW) said Thursday.

item.title: China rocket debris may have fallen near Patag Island in WPS --PhilSA
item.content:encoded: Debris from China"s rocket launch may have dropped near Rozul Reef and Patag Island in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Marcos wants strengthened efforts vs. tobacco smuggling
item.content:encoded:
Customs, BIR, tobacco smuggling, vape products, Bongbong Marcos Jr. Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has urged the Bureau of Customs (BOC) and the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) to enhance their efforts in combating the smuggling of tobacco and vape products. He emphasized the importance of strengthening measures to prevent the illegal entry of these items into the country, which not only poses a threat to public health but also affects revenue collection. By calling for stricter enforcement and collaboration between the agencies, Marcos hopes to crack down on illicit activities that undermine regulatory efforts and harm legitimate businesses. Recognizing the detrimental impacts of smuggling on both the economy and society, he is determined to address this issue effectively and protect the interests of the Filipino people. The President's directive underscores the government's commitment to upholding law and order, safeguarding public welfare, and promoting a thriving market environment free from illicit trade.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. has called on the Bureau of Customs (BOC) and the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) to strengthen measures that will combat smuggling of tobacco and vape products.

item.title: DFA warns vs 'unverifiable recordings' of PH-China 'new model' deal
item.content:encoded:
warning, Department of Foreign Affairs, threat, unverifiable recordings, Ayungin Shoal Summary: The Department of Foreign Affairs issued a warning about a reported threat involving the release of unverifiable recordings concerning a new model arrangement in Ayungin Shoal. The DFA urged caution in dealing with any such recordings and emphasized the importance of verifying information before accepting it as fact. The issue at hand relates to a potentially sensitive situation at Ayungin Shoal, a disputed area in the South China Sea. The alleged recordings could be used to manipulate or mislead public perception, causing further tensions in the already contentious region. The DFA's warning serves as a reminder of the need for vigilance and critical thinking when consuming information in today's digital age.

The Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) on Thursday issued a warning amid the reported threat to release "unverifiable recordings" concerning the alleged "new model" arrangement in Ayungin Shoal.

item.title: Ex-professor sa Cotabato, nag-sorry matapos ipangalan sa kaniya ang thesis ng dating estudyante
item.content:encoded:
University of Southern Mindanao, public apology, former professor, thesis, plagiarism Summary: A former professor from the University of Southern Mindanao in Kabacan, Cotabato issued a public apology after publishing a thesis under his name that was actually written by a former student. The professor admitted to the act of plagiarism and expressed regret for his actions. The incident raised concerns about academic integrity and ethics within the institution. The professor acknowledged the mistake and took responsibility for the unauthorized publication of the student's work. The university may implement stricter measures to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. The apology serves as a reminder of the importance of academic honesty and proper attribution in scholarly pursuits.

Naglabas ng public apology ang isang dating propesor ng University of Southern Mindanao (USM) sa Kabacan, Cotabato matapos niyang i-publish ang thesis ng dati niyang estudyante na nakapangalan sa kaniya.

item.title: Rains return to flooded southern Brazil, interrupting rescues
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Brazil, flood, authorities, rescue efforts, casualties

Authorities in Brazil have halted rescue operations in flood-affected areas due to ongoing rain and the potential for lightning and strong winds. The catastrophe has claimed the lives of at least 100 people, with over 163,000 individuals seeking refuge. The worsening weather conditions present challenges for further rescue efforts, making it unsafe for responders and those affected by the floods. The devastation in southern Brazil has led to significant casualties, and the situation remains critical as the region continues to grapple with the aftermath of the floods. The government and emergency services are working tirelessly to provide assistance and support to those impacted by the disaster, but the risk of worsening weather conditions poses a serious threat to ongoing relief efforts.

Summary: Brazil is facing a dire situation with over 100 casualties and 163,000 individuals seeking shelter due to severe flooding. Authorities have been forced to interrupt rescue operations due to the risk of lightning and strong winds, further complicating efforts to assist those affected by the disaster.

Authorities interrupted rescue efforts in flood-ravaged southern Brazil on Wednesday amid more rain and the risk of lightning and stiff winds that threaten to exacerbate a catastrophe that has already killed at least 100 people and left over 163,000 seeking shelter.

item.title: Spend one minute to pray for peace, says CBCP official
item.content:encoded:
Israel, Palestine, Ukraine, wars, peace

Summary: The Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) is calling for urgent prayers to end the wars in Israel, Palestine, Ukraine, and other conflict-torn areas around the world. They emphasize the need for peace in the midst of ongoing violence and conflict, urging individuals to dedicate time to prayer for the resolution of these conflicts. The CBCP official highlights the importance of collective efforts in seeking peace and stability in these regions, emphasizing the impact of prayer in promoting reconciliation and ending hostilities. Amidst the escalating violence and humanitarian crises in these war-torn areas, the CBCP stresses the crucial role of prayer in advocating for peace and justice, and in solidarity with those affected by the conflict. The call to pray for peace reflects the Catholic Church's commitment to promoting peace and dialogue in regions plagued by violence and conflict.

There is an urgent need to spend time to pray for peace to end the wars in Israel, Palestine, Ukraine, and other parts of the world, said an official of the Catholic Bishops" Conference of the Philippines (CBCP).

item.title: Hamas sticks to its approval of truce proposal, senior official says
item.content:encoded:
member, Hamas, truce proposal, approval, steadfast Summary: Hamas, as represented by Izzat El-Reshiq, remains committed to its stance on a truce proposal and has continued to support it. The political bureau member emphasized Hamas's approval of the truce proposal, demonstrating the organization's unwavering position on the matter. This statement highlights the importance Hamas places on maintaining its position and upholding its decision regarding the truce proposal. The affirmation of their approval suggests that Hamas is dedicated to seeing the proposal through, despite any challenges or obstacles that may arise. This steadfastness from Hamas indicates a resolute and determined approach to working towards a potential truce, emphasizing the organization's commitment to diplomatic efforts and conflict resolution.

Hamas has remained steadfast to its position towards a truce proposal and stuck to its approval of it, a member of Hamas' political bureau, Izzat El-Reshiq, said in a statement on Thursday.

item.title: Only three days of fuel left for health services in south of Gaza, says WHO
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: fuel, health services, Gaza, World Health Organization, shortage
Summary: The World Health Organization has reported that there is only enough fuel to run health services in the southern part of Gaza for three more days due to a shortage. This crisis puts the health and well-being of residents at risk as hospitals may be forced to shut down without access to essential resources. The fuel shortage is a critical issue that needs urgent attention to ensure that medical facilities can continue to operate and provide necessary care to those in need. The situation highlights the ongoing challenges faced by healthcare services in Gaza and the need for sustainable solutions to address the recurring fuel shortages that impact the delivery of healthcare to the population. It is essential for immediate action to be taken to address this crisis and prevent further disruption to vital health services in the region.


There is only enough fuel to run health services in the south of Gaza for three more days, the World Health Organization said on Wednesday.

item.title: Philippines in position to seek 2nd arbitration, says think tank
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Philippines, arbitration, China, South China Sea, Pacific Forum Summary: The Philippines has the advantage of seeking a second arbitration opposing China's claims in the South China Sea, according to the Hawaii-based foreign policy think tank Pacific Forum. This move could potentially strengthen the Philippines' position in the ongoing disputes in the region. The previous arbitration ruling in 2016 favored the Philippines, and a second arbitration could serve as a way to further assert their rights in the South China Sea. The Pacific Forum's analysis suggests that pursuing another arbitration could help address China's aggressive territorial claims and assert the rule of law in the maritime disputes. This strategic move would demonstrate the Philippines' commitment to upholding international law and protecting its maritime interests.

The Philippines has the advantage of seeking a second arbitration opposing China"s claims in the South China Sea, according to the Hawaii-based foreign policy think tank Pacific Forum.

item.title: Special permits to be issued in routes without consolidated jeepneys --LTFRB
item.content:encoded:
LTFRB, special permits, authorized PUVs, routes, consolidated jeepneys Summary: The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) announced plans to issue special permits for authorized public utility vehicles (PUVs) in routes lacking consolidated jeepneys. This move aims to address transportation challenges faced by commuters in areas where traditional jeepneys are scarce. The special permits will enable authorized PUVs to operate in these routes, providing much-needed transportation options for the public. The initiative is part of the government's efforts to improve public transportation services and ensure the mobility of commuters. By allowing authorized PUVs to ply in these routes, the LTFRB seeks to expand transportation options and enhance accessibility for commuters, especially in areas with limited jeepney services. Overall, the issuance of special permits for authorized PUVs represents a proactive step towards addressing transportation gaps and improving the overall commuting experience for the public.

Summary:

The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) said it would issue special permits to allow authorized public utility vehicles (PUVs) to ply in routes without consolidated jeepneys, according to a "24 Oras" report by Oscar Oida.

item.title: Prince Harry appears, alone, for UK Invictus Games service
item.content:encoded:
Rare appearance, Prince Harry, UK, service, Invictus Games

Prince Harry made a rare public appearance in the UK to attend a service marking the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games. The event garnered significant attention due to the strained relations within his family, particularly with his brother Prince William and father Prince Charles. Despite the tension, Harry participated in the service, honoring the wounded veterans who have competed in the Invictus Games over the past decade. The event highlighted the ongoing rift between Harry and the rest of the royal family following his decision to step back as a senior royal and move to the United States with his wife Meghan Markle. The appearance served as a reminder of the complexities within the royal family and the challenges they continue to face in maintaining their public image while dealing with internal conflicts. Overall, the service provided a brief moment of unity and shared purpose as the royals came together to celebrate the athletes and supporters of the Invictus Games.

Summary:
Prince Harry made a rare public appearance in the UK for the 10th anniversary service of the Invictus Games, overshadowed by strained relations with his family, highlighting ongoing tensions but also moments of shared purpose and unity.

Prince Harry made a rare public appearance in the UK when he attended a service to mark the Invictus Games' 10th anniversary, with strained relations with his family dominating attention.

item.title: National Museum, Cebu archdiocese to discuss terms of return of Boljoon church panels
item.content:encoded: The National Museum of the Philippines (NMP) is set to discuss with Cebu church officials the conditions that would be included in an agreement on the return of the panels of Boljoon church.

item.title: Kabuhayan ng mga magtatahong sa Navotas, nanganganib dahil sa reclamation project
item.content:encoded:
Navotas, reclamation project, Manila Bay, livelihood, families Summary: The reclamation project in Manila Bay poses a threat to the livelihood of generations of families in Navotas whose homes will be affected. The long-standing industry that has supported many families in the area is at risk of disappearing as the project encroaches on their fishing grounds, leaving them with no means of income. The community is deeply concerned about the potential loss of their way of life and the impact it will have on their families. The project's development could lead to the displacement of residents and disruption of the longstanding traditions and practices that have sustained them for years. Additionally, the environmental implications of the reclamation project raise further concerns about the sustainability of the marine resources that these families depend on for their survival. The fate of Navotas and its residents hangs in the balance as they face an uncertain future amidst the looming threat of the Manila Bay reclamation project.


Ang industriya na ilang henerasyon na bumuhay sa maraming pamilya ng mga nagtatahong sa Navotas, nanganganib na mawala dahil sa reclamation project sa Manila Bay. Ang kanilang mga tahongan na tatamaan ng proyekto sa laot, isa-isang binubunot.

item.title: No winners of Grand Lotto 6/55, Megalotto 6/45 on Wednesday, May 8, 2024
item.content:encoded:
lotto, draws, winners, Wednesday, May 8, 2024

There were no winners in the big lotto draws that took place on Wednesday, May 8, 2024. Both draws concluded without anyone matching all the numbers, resulting in no jackpot winners. This news comes as a disappointment to many hopeful participants who eagerly awaited the results. The lack of winners means that the prize money will roll over to the next drawing, increasing the potential jackpot for the next round. The draws, which are typically held on a regular basis, attract a large number of players who dream of striking it rich by correctly choosing the winning numbers. The next draw is expected to generate even more excitement as players vie for their chance to win the growing jackpot. With the previous draw yielding no winners, the anticipation and interest in the upcoming draw are sure to be heightened.

Summary:

There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws held on Wednesday, May 8, 2024.

item.title: Dog tips off Customs on P56-million shabu in balikbayan box
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: sniffer dog, Bureau of Customs, drug shipment, balikbayan box, Manila International Container Port (MICP) Summary: A sniffer dog detected a drug shipment worth over P56 million hidden inside a balikbayan box at the Manila International Container Port (MICP). The Bureau of Customs was alerted to the illegal contents by the canine, leading to the discovery of the contraband. The drugs were carefully concealed within the box, indicating a sophisticated smuggling operation. The authorities seized the shipment and launched an investigation to determine those responsible for the illegal activity. This incident highlights the importance of canine units in detecting illegal substances and preventing them from entering the country. The Bureau of Customs is commended for their swift action in intercepting the drug shipment and preventing it from reaching its intended destination. Such successful operations are crucial in combating drug trafficking and ensuring the safety and security of the community.

Summary:

A sniffer dog tipped off members of the Bureau of Customs on a drug shipment worth over P56 million inside a balikbayan box at the Manila International Container Port (MICP).

item.title: Survivor recounts moment South African building collapsed
item.content:encoded: Construction worker Moses Malala, 34, recalled the moment the five-storey building collapsed and a cloud of dust engulfed him. Scarred by the death of a co-worker, he is unable to sleep.

item.title: Wife of detained foreigner nabbed for alleged extortion
item.content:encoded: The National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) Anti-Organized and Transnational Crime Division arrested the wife of a detained Cameroon national after allegedly extorting money from a relative of another detainee in exchange for the latter's release.

item.title: Hong Kong court bans protest anthem, saying it can be used as a weapon
item.content:encoded: Hong Kong's appeals court granted a government bid to ban the protest anthem "Glory to Hong Kong," overturning a lower court judgment that nixed a ban due to "chilling effects" on free speech.

item.title: Plastik na bote na may tubig at tina, epektibo nga bang pangtaboy sa aso na dumudumi sa tapat ng bahay?
item.content:encoded: Problema ng isang ginang sa Las Piñas City ang mga aso na dumudumi sa labas ng kaniyang bahay. Ang natuklasan niyang paraan para malutas ang problema: tubig na may tinunaw na tina na inilagay niya sa plastic bottle at inilagay sa labas ng bahay.

item.title: AFP on China claim: Audio can be forged with deep fakes
item.content:encoded: The Armed Forces of the Philippines on Wednesday said it wouldn't dignify China's claims that it agreed to "a new model" for conduct in the Ayungin Shoal, saying audio recordings could be manufactured with deep fake technology.

item.title: South Gaza hospitals have only three days" fuel left --WHO
item.content:encoded: Despite international objections, Israel sent tanks into overcrowded Rafah on Tuesday and seized the nearby crossing into Egypt that is the main conduit for aid into Gaza.

item.title: Senate probe on 'PDEA leaks' a smear campaign, admin solons say
item.content:encoded:
Senate inquiry, PDEA documents, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., drugs, smear campaign
Summary: The Senate inquiry into the alleged PDEA documents connecting President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to drugs has been deemed a smear campaign against the administration by its supporters. Administration solons have criticized the investigation, dismissing it as a deliberate attempt to tarnish the reputation of the administration. The supposed documents implicating the President in drug-related activities have been met with skepticism and accusations of being politically motivated. Critics argue that the timing of the inquiry and the release of these documents raise suspicions about their authenticity and intent. The administration maintains that President Marcos Jr. has no involvement in any illegal drug activities and condemns the inquiry as a baseless attack on his character. The Senate inquiry has sparked controversy and division, with both sides fiercely defending their positions and casting doubt on the credibility of the supposed evidence. The political implications of the investigation are significant, as it highlights the ongoing power struggle and animosity between rival factions in the government. The outcome of the inquiry remains uncertain as both sides continue to engage in a heated debate over the legitimacy and motives behind the alleged PDEA documents.


The Senate inquiry on the supposed PDEA documents linking President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to drugs is part of a smear campaign against the administration, administration solons have said.

item.title: Revilla: Other parties welcome to join PFP-Lakas CMD alliance
item.content:encoded:
Partido Federal ng Pilipinas, Lakas-CMD, Senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr., alliance, parties Summary: Senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr. announced that the Partido Federal ng Pilipinas and Lakas-CMD are open to forming alliances with other political parties. They are willing to collaborate and work together towards common goals. This move aims to create a strong and unified front that can address the various issues and challenges facing the country. Revilla emphasized the importance of unity and cooperation among different parties to achieve progress and development. By keeping their doors open, they hope to attract more parties to join their alliance and contribute to the betterment of the nation.

Summary:

Senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr. on Wednesday said that the Partido Federal ng Pilipinas and Lakas-CMD are not closing their doors to other parties that may want to join their alliance.

item.title: 4,000 residents affected by drought, forest fires in Benguet receive aid from GMA Kapuso Foundation
item.content:encoded:
Residents, Tuba, Tublay, Itogon, Benguet Summary: - 4,000 residents in Tuba, Tublay, and Itogon, Benguet affected by drought - Received food packs and hygiene kits from GMA Kapuso Foundation - Assistance provided to alleviate the impact of the drought - Support extended to residents in need of essential supplies - GMA Kapuso Foundation aiding communities in Benguet amidst water scarcity challenges

Summary: 4,000 residents in Tuba, Tublay, and Itogon, Benguet affected by drought received food packs and hygiene kits from GMA Kapuso Foundation to alleviate the impact of the water scarcity. The support provided essential supplies to residents in need and showcased the commitment of GMA Kapuso Foundation in aiding communities in Benguet dealing with the challenges of drought.

A total of 4,000 residents in Tuba, Tublay, and Itogon, Benguet who were affected by drought received food packs and hygiene kits from the GMA Kapuso Foundation.

item.title: 1,000 flock to BSP to claim trillions of pesos from 'gold hoard'
item.content:encoded: More than 1,000 people converged Wednesday at the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) in Manila City to claim a staggering P130 trillion for the Filipino people -- money which the financial institution said it cannot give away.

item.title: Rider na naghatid ng anak, patay nang sumalpok sa kasalubong na van sa Batangas
item.content:encoded: Nasawi ang isang 59-anyos na rider matapos na sumalpok sa kasalubong na van sa pakurbang bahagi ng kalsada sa Nasugbu, Batangas.

item.title: On 20th year of 'Hello, Garci,' Poe seeks tougher law vs. vote-buying
item.content:encoded: Senator Grace Poe on Wednesday took to the Senate plenary the need for electoral reforms, particularly stricter measures against vote-buying in the age of technology as she remembered the "Hello Garci" controversy that was exposed 20 years ago.

item.title: Isang isla sa Cebu, ilang dekada nang 'uhaw' sa malinis at maiinom na tubig
item.content:encoded: Kahit napaliligiran ng katubigan, ilang henerasyon nang problema ng mga residente sa isla ng Moamboc sa Bantayan, Cebu ang kawalan nila ng malinis na tubig, lalo ang inumin. Ang mga walang pambili ng purified water, tinitiis na inumin kahit ang tubig na may kasamang alat.

item.title: Probe launched after Boeing cargo plane lands in Istanbul without front landing gear
item.content:encoded: The aircraft, flying from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport, informed the control tower in Istanbul that its landing gear had failed to open and touched down with guidance from the tower.

item.title: UP Mindanao to offer medicine program in 2025
item.content:encoded: The University of the Philippines (UP) Mindanao announced on Tuesday that it would open its medical school in 2025.

item.title: Abalos says Northern Samar barangays now free from communists
item.content:encoded:
Interior Secretary Benhur Abalos, Northern Samar, barangays, guerilla fronts, communist groups
Summary: Interior Secretary Benhur Abalos announced that all barangays in Northern Samar are now free from guerilla fronts and communist groups. This achievement marks a significant milestone in the government's fight against insurgency in the region. Abalos credited the success to the collaborative efforts of the military, local government units, and barangay officials in implementing various programs aimed at addressing the root causes of insurgency. The clearance of these barangays reflects the government's commitment to bringing peace and development to conflict-affected areas. Abalos also highlighted the importance of sustaining peace and security in the region to attract investments and promote economic growth. The declaration of barangays in Northern Samar as free from guerilla fronts and communist groups is a positive step towards achieving lasting peace and stability in the area.

Interior Secretary Benhur Abalos on Wednesday said all barangays in Northern Samar are now free from guerilla fronts and communist groups.

item.title: PAGASA: 25 areas under danger level heat index on May 9
item.content:encoded:
heat index, dangerous levels, PAGASA, 25 areas, Thursday Summary: PAGASA, the state weather bureau, has warned that the heat index in 25 areas across the Philippines is expected to reach dangerous levels on Thursday, May 9. The heat index measures how hot it feels to the human body when relative humidity is factored in with the actual air temperature. Prolonged exposure to high heat index levels can lead to heat-related illnesses such as heat exhaustion and heat stroke. It is important for residents in the affected areas to take precautions to stay hydrated, seek shade, and avoid prolonged exposure to direct sunlight. PAGASA advises the public to stay updated on weather forecasts and listen to advisories to ensure their safety during the hot weather conditions.

Summary:

State weather bureau PAGASA predicted that the heat index would rise to dangerous levels in 25 areas across the country on Thursday, May 9.

item.title: Cebu City mayor Michael Rama, sinuspinde ng Ombudsman ng 6 na buwan
item.content:encoded:
Office of the Ombudsman, Cebu City mayor Michael Rama, suspension, seven officials, transfer, non-payment Summary: The Office of the Ombudsman has suspended Cebu City mayor Michael Rama and seven other city officials for six months due to their involvement in transferring four employees to other agencies without paying them. The suspension was a result of an investigation that found the officials to be in violation of the law. This move by the Ombudsman serves as a warning to other officials who may engage in similar practices. Mayor Rama and the other suspended officials will need to serve their suspension and face consequences for their actions. This case highlights the importance of following proper procedures and protocols when it comes to employee transfers and ensuring that workers are compensated appropriately.

Sinuspinde ng Office of the Ombudsman ng anim na buwan si Cebu City mayor Michael Rama, at pito pang opisyal ng lungsod kaugnay sa paglilipat sa apat na kawani sa ibang ahensiya at hindi rin nakasahod.

item.title: US pauses some weapons to Israel as battles rage around Rafah
item.content:encoded: The United States, which is seeking to stave off an Israeli invasion of Rafah, said it believes a revised Hamas ceasefire proposal may lead to a breakthrough in an impasse in negotiations.

item.title: Batang pugo vendor, ipina-take-out ang ibinigay na pagkain sa kaniya para ipasalubong sa lola
item.content:encoded: Naantig ang netizens sa isang post tungkol sa isang batang lalaki na nagbebenta ng pugo sa kalsada. Sa halip kasi na kainin ang libreng pagkain na ibinigay sa kaniya ng may-ari ng isang pastry shop, hiniling niya na i-take-out na lang para ipasalubong niya sa kaniyang lola. Bakit kaya siya natutong kumayod sa murang edad ang bata?

item.title: Mass casualty incident simulation isinagawa bilang paghahanda sa malakas na lindol
item.content:encoded: Isang mass casualty incident simulation ang isinagawa ng Philippine Red Cross sa Mandaluyong City nitong Miyerkoles.

item.title: 6-month suspension up against Cebu City mayor, 7 others
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Cebu City, Mayor Michael Rama, officials, preventive suspension, six months Summary: The Cebu City Mayor Michael Rama and seven other officials of the city government have been placed under preventive suspension for a period of six months. This decision was made in response to allegations of irregularities and misconduct in the city government. The suspension is aimed at preventing any further potential wrongdoing and to allow for a thorough investigation to take place. The Mayor and the other officials are expected to comply with the suspension order and are required to vacate their positions during this period. The suspension serves as a precautionary measure to ensure transparency and accountability within the government. The affected officials will not be able to perform their duties and responsibilities for the duration of the suspension, with interim measures likely to be put in place to ensure the continued operation of the city government.

Cebu City Mayor Michael Rama and seven other officials of Cebu City government are placed under preventive suspension for six months.

item.title: Sandro Marcos shares Mother's Day wish for First Lady Liza
item.content:encoded:
President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., Mother's Day, eldest son, wish, First Lady Liza Araneta Marcos Summary: On Mother's Day, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr.'s eldest son expressed his wish for First Lady Liza Araneta Marcos. Although the specific details of the wish were not disclosed, it is clear that the gesture was made to honor and appreciate the First Lady on this special occasion. The bond between family members, especially on such a meaningful day, highlights the importance of familial relationships and the love and respect that they share. This public display of affection serves to showcase the unity and support within the Marcos family, emphasizing the significance of celebrating and acknowledging the matriarch of the family. As Mother's Day is a time to recognize and express gratitude to mothers for their love and sacrifices, the wish from President Marcos Jr.'s eldest son for the First Lady reflects a sentiment of appreciation and admiration for her role in the family.

For Mother's Day, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr.'s eldest son has a wish for First Lady Liza Araneta Marcos.

item.title: BI implements revised dress code for employees amid extreme heat
item.content:encoded:
Bureau of Immigration, employees, smart casual uniforms, scorching heat, relief Summary: The Bureau of Immigration has allowed its employees to wear smart casual uniforms as a relief from the scorching heat. This decision was made in response to the hot weather conditions that the employees were facing while working. The new dress code will provide employees with more comfort and flexibility in their clothing choices. By allowing smart casual attire, the Bureau is promoting a more relaxed and comfortable work environment for its employees. This change will help boost morale and productivity among staff members and ensure that they can work more comfortably during the hot summer months.

Summary:

The Bureau of Immigration (BI) has allowed its employees to wear smart casual uniforms as a relief from the scorching heat.

item.title: Ask Duterte to 'gentleman"s agreement" probe? Best to get info from horse"s mouth, says Risa
item.content:encoded: For Senator Risa Hontiveros, it would be best to hear from Rodrigo Duterte himself about the supposed "gentleman's agreement" allegedly brokered by the former president with China.

item.title: PH-US troops 'assault' mock enemy ship in Ilocos Norte
item.content:encoded: Philippine and United States forces conducted a maritime strike exercise targeting a mock enemy ship on the west coast of Ilocos Norte on Wednesday as part of their Balikatan Exercises, the Philippine Navy said.

item.title: 2 nabbed for posing as MMDA enforcers
item.content:encoded: Two individuals, including a former traffic enforcer of the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA), were nabbed for allegedly flagging down vehicles while posing as traffic constables last Saturday.

item.title: Nasa 1,000 katao, nagtungo sa tanggapan ng BSP sa Maynila para 'komolekta' umano ng tig-P1-M
item.content:encoded: Mula sa iba't ibang karatig na lalawigan, nagtungo sa tanggapan ng Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) sa Maynila ang nasa 1,000 katao na napaniwalang makakakolekta sila ng tig-P1 milyon mula sa tinatawag na nag-mature na "public account."

item.title: New members of elite Swiss Guard sworn in to protect the Pope
item.content:encoded: Known to tourists in St Peter's Square for its colorful yellow, red and blue uniforms and ceremonial halberd weapons, the "world's smallest army" was founded by Pope Julius II in 1506.

item.title: Imee on supposed ouster plot vs. Marcos: 'Walang katibayan'
item.content:encoded: Senator Imee Marcos dismissed the claim of former Senator Antonio Trillanes IV that there's an alleged ouster plot against her brother.

item.title: RTWPBs to start minimum wage hike review -- DOLE
item.content:encoded: Several regional wage boards will soon begin reviewing the minimum wage rates, Labor Secretary Bienvenido Laguesma said Wednesday.

item.title: Teodoro: Expel from PH those responsible in alleged recording of China-PH 'new model" deal
item.content:encoded: Defense Secretary Gilberto Teodoro Jr. on Wednesday said those responsible in recording the alleged conversation between Chinese and Filipino officials about the supposed “new model” deal over Ayungin Shoal be should be expelled from the Philippines.

item.title: Chinese Embassy dared to show 'new model' recording to PH gov't
item.content:encoded: The supposed audio recording proving the conversation between a Chinese diplomat and a Philippine military official on the supposed "new model" concerning the West Philippine Sea (WPS) should be made available to the Executive Department, Senate Deputy Minority Leader Risa Hontiveros said on Wednesday.

item.title: DepEd vows shortened SY 2024-2025 won't result in further learning losses
item.content:encoded: The Department of Education (DepEd) on Wednesday admitted some challenges in its proposal to shorten School Year 2024-2025 to revert the April-May school break, saying they have to come up with interventions to ensure that it will not result in additional learning losses among students.

item.title: Hontiveros urges Senate leadership, Executive Dep't to act on recommended POGO ban
item.content:encoded: Senate Deputy Minority Leader Risa Hontiveros called on the Executive Department and the Senate leadership on Wednesday to act quickly on the recommendation to ban the Philippine Offshore Gaming Operators (POGO) in the country, noting that crimes related to the industry have been going on for about four years already.

item.title: Alyansa ng PFP ni Marcos at Lakas-CMD ni Romualdez, sinelyohan para sa Eleksyon 2025
item.content:encoded: Dinaluhan ni Pangulong Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. ang pagsasanib-puwersa ng kaniyang partido na Partido Federal ng Pilipinas (PFP) at ang Lakas-CMD ng kaniyang pinsan na si House Speaker Ferdinand Martin Romualdez, para paghandaan ang May 2025 midterm elections.

item.title: Family planning mobile clinic to offer free services across Luzon
item.content:encoded:
ambulatory clinic, family planning, contraceptives, Luzon, free
Summary:
Health advocates welcomed the introduction of a family planning ambulatory clinic that will travel across Luzon, providing free modern contraceptives to Filipinos seeking to space or limit pregnancies. The initiative aims to cater to individuals looking for effective family planning solutions and promote access to modern contraceptive methods in various provinces of Luzon. The clinic's provision of free services is expected to enhance reproductive health options for the Filipino population and support their decisions regarding family planning. This mobile clinic will play a crucial role in addressing the unmet need for family planning services and empowering individuals to make informed choices about their reproductive health. The availability of modern contraceptives through this initiative marks a significant step towards promoting health and well-being among the Filipino population.

Health advocates on Wednesday welcomed the family planning ambulatory clinic that will be traveling in provinces across Luzon, providing free modern types of contraceptives to Filipinos who wish to space or limit pregnancy.

item.title: Balikbayan box with P56M shabu intercepted at Manila port
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: balikbayan box, Thailand, intercepted, Manila International Container Port, shabu Summary: A balikbayan box originating from Thailand was seized at Manila International Container Port after authorities discovered methamphetamine, or shabu, worth P56.3 million concealed inside. The interception highlights the ongoing battle against illegal drug trafficking in the Philippines. This incident also underscores the importance of stringent customs checks and border security measures to prevent the entry of illicit substances into the country. The authorities acted swiftly to intercept the illegal shipment and prevent the dangerous drugs from reaching the streets. The discovery of such a significant amount of shabu hidden within a seemingly harmless balikbayan box reinforces the need for thorough inspections of all incoming cargo to safeguard communities from the harmful effects of drug abuse. The authorities' vigilance in intercepting the illegal drugs demonstrates their commitment to protecting the welfare and safety of the public.

Summary:

A balikbayan box from Thailand was intercepted at Manila International Container Port after authorities found P56.3 million worth of shabu

item.title: Marcos highlights unity as PFP, Lakas-CMD ink alliance pact
item.content:encoded:
alliance, pact, 2025 midterm polls, President Bongbong Marcos Jr., unity
Summary: President Bongbong Marcos Jr. emphasized the importance of unity as the Partido Federal ng Pilipinas and Lakas-CMD signed an alliance pact for the 2025 midterm polls. The two parties coming together signifies a step towards solving society's problems. The alliance between the parties, led by President Marcos Jr., aims to address the challenges facing the country through collaborative efforts. By working together, they hope to bring about positive change and progress for the Filipino people. President Marcos Jr.'s message underscores the need for cohesive action and solidarity in addressing pressing issues and working towards a better future for the nation.

As Partido Federal ng Pilipinas and Lakas-CMD signed an alliance pact for the 2025 midterm polls, President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Wednesday highlighted the importance of unity especially when it comes to solving the society's problems.

item.title: 'Weak' phreatic eruption observed at Taal Volcano
item.content:encoded: Weak phreatic eruption, or a steam-driven explosion, was observed at Taal Volcano's main crater on Wednesday, according to PHIVOLCS in an advisory.

item.title: Japan, Sweden to join civilian WPS mission
item.content:encoded: Private individuals and embassy personnel from Japan and Sweden are expected to join the second civilian mission to the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Ex-Pres. Duterte slams revocation of permit to hold peace rally in Dumaguete
item.content:encoded: Former President Rodrigo Duterte on Tuesday cried foul over the revocation of their permit to hold a peace rally in Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental, saying Malacañang could be behind it.

item.title: Dugong, nilaro at sinakyan ng mga bata sa baybayin sa Palawan
item.content:encoded: Hinawakan, nilaro at sinakyan ng mga bata ang isang dugong na lumapit sa kanila sa isang dalampasigan sa Cagayancillo, Palawan.

item.title: China's alleged 'new model' deal over Ayungin Shoal invalid --Carpio
item.content:encoded: The alleged “new model” deal between China and the Philippines over Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea was invalid, retired Supreme Court Justice Antonio Carpio said Wednesday.

item.title: DOLE: 8K permits given to foreign workers from Jan-April 2024
item.content:encoded: DOLE has already issued around 8,000 alien employment permits (AEP) to foreign workers employed in licensed internet gaming operators in the country.

item.title: SC grants writ of amparo to 'red-tagged' ex-Bayan Muna lawmaker
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court (SC) has ruled that red-tagging and guilt by association threaten a person"s right to life, liberty, or security as it granted a writ of amparo in favor of former Bayan Muna lawmaker Siegfred Deduro.

item.title: Lalaking pinagtulungang gulpihin sa Navotas, nanaksak; 1 patay, 2 sugatan
item.content:encoded:
saksakin, sugatan, Navotas City, restobar, depensa Summary:
- A man was killed while two others were injured after being stabbed by a man they had helped beat up outside a restobar in Navotas City.
- The suspect claimed self-defense in the incident.

Nasawi ang isang lalaki habang dalawa ang sugatan matapos silang saksakin ng lalaking kanilang pinagtulungang gulpihin sa labas ng isang restobar sa Navotas City. Depensa ng suspek, ipinagtanggol lamang niya ang sarili.

item.title: Russia used over 50 missiles, 20 drones in overnight attack on Ukraine --Zelenskiy
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Russia, missiles, drones, attack, infrastructure Summary: Russia launched an overnight attack on Ukraine's infrastructure using more than 50 missiles and 20 drones, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy. The attack significantly damaged critical infrastructure, including roads, residential buildings, and energy facilities. Zelenskiy condemned the attack as a violation of Ukraine's sovereignty and called for international support to defend against further aggression. The use of advanced missile and drone technology highlights the escalating conflict between the two neighboring countries. The attack has raised concerns about the potential for further violence and instability in the region. Zelenskiy vowed to retaliate against the Russian aggression and protect Ukraine's territorial integrity. The international community has condemned Russia's actions and called for a diplomatic solution to the crisis.

Summary: Russia launched a devastating attack on Ukraine's infrastructure using missiles and drones, causing significant damage and raising concerns about further violence and instability in the region. Ukrainian President Zelenskiy condemned the attack and called for international support to defend against further aggression.

Russia used more than 50 missiles and 20 drones in overnight attack on Ukraine's infrastructure on Wednesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy wrote on Telegram.

item.title: BuCor relieves 7 officers amid probe on NBP strip search
item.content:encoded:
strip search, BuCor officers, relieved, wives, NBP Summary: In connection with the investigation on the conduct of strip searches on wives of PDLs at NBP, seven BuCor officers have been relieved of their posts. The officers' actions were deemed inappropriate and led to their removal from their positions. The strip searches conducted by the officers on the wives of PDLs raised concerns about the violation of privacy and ethical standards in the correctional facility. The investigation into this incident shed light on the need for strict protocols and guidelines regarding conducting searches on visitors at the NBP. The relieved officers will be subject to further disciplinary actions as the investigation progresses.

Summary:

Seven Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) officers have been relieved of their posts in connection with the investigation on their conduct of strip search on wives of persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) at the New Bilibid Prison (NBP).

item.title: Lalaking gustong umiwas sa init, sa lilim ng pader kumakapit
item.content:encoded: Tila isang espiya ang galawan ng isang lalaki na "kumakapit" sa lilim ng pader para makaiwas sa sobrang init.

item.title: Marcos party PFP, Lakas-CMD ink alliance, to field common Senate bets
item.content:encoded:
Partido Federal ng Pilipinas, Lakas-CMD, alliance pact, May 2025 elections, national political parties Summary: Partido Federal ng Pilipinas and Lakas-CMD, two national political parties, signed an alliance pact on Wednesday for the May 2025 elections. This strategic move aims to strengthen their political influence and increase their chances of winning in the upcoming elections. By forming an alliance, the parties can pool their resources, expertise, and support base to create a more formidable front against their rivals. The alliance between Partido Federal ng Pilipinas and Lakas-CMD could potentially shake up the political landscape in the Philippines and challenge the dominance of existing political players. With both parties joining forces, they can leverage their respective strengths and reach a wider audience of voters. This partnership signals a significant development in the political arena and sets the stage for a closely watched electoral showdown in 2025.

Summary:

Two national political parties, Partido Federal ng Pilipinas and Lakas-CMD, signed on Wednesday an alliance pact for the May 2025 elections.

item.title: DOJ's Remulla orders probe on NBP strip searches
item.content:encoded:
investigation, strip searches, families, persons deprived of liberty, Justice Secretary Summary: The Justice Secretary, Jesus Crispin Remulla, has initiated an investigation into reports of strip searches being carried out on the families of individuals deprived of liberty (PDLS). This action comes in response to concerns regarding the treatment of these families and the potential violation of their rights. The investigation will aim to uncover the truth behind these allegations and hold those responsible accountable for their actions. The issue of strip searches on PDLS' families raises serious questions about the practices and policies within correctional facilities and underscores the importance of upholding human rights standards for all individuals, regardless of their legal status. Justice Secretary Remulla's decision to probe these reports demonstrates a commitment to ensuring transparency and accountability in the justice system and protecting the rights of all individuals involved in the criminal justice system.

Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla has ordered an investigation into reports of strip searches being conducted on families of persons deprived of liberty (PDLS).

item.title: Bong Revilla says he's on his way to recovery
item.content:encoded:
recovery, Senator Bong Revilla Jr, partial tear, Achilles heel, injury Summary: Senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr. is on the path to recovery after experiencing a partial tear in his Achilles heel. He shared that he is recovering well and is grateful for the support and prayers he has received from his colleagues and the public. Revilla sustained the injury as a result of a game of basketball and underwent surgery to address the issue. Despite the setback, he remains optimistic and determined to bounce back stronger. The senator expressed his appreciation for the medical team who assisted him throughout the healing process. Revilla's positive outlook and perseverance serve as an inspiration to others facing challenges, showcasing his resilience and determination to overcome obstacles.

Senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr. on Wednesday said he is on his way to recovery after suffering a partial tear on his Achilles heel.

item.title: Quiboloy camp surrendered 5 firearms, says PNP
item.content:encoded: The camp of Kingdom of Jesus Christ leader Pastor Apollo Quiboloy has surrendered to the police five firearms registered to the controversial religious leader.

item.title: DOJ to give Marcos 'briefer' on legal options for possible ICC warrants
item.content:encoded: The DOJ is preparing a briefer on the legal options available to President Marcos regarding any arrest warrants that may be issued by the ICC.

item.title: Marcos: P59.8-B health emergency allowance distributed to medical frontliners
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: P59.8 billion, medical frontline workers, health emergency allowance, COVID-19 pandemic, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. Summary: At least P59.8 billion has been distributed to medical frontline workers as health emergency allowance during the COVID-19 pandemic. This allocation was confirmed by President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. The significant amount signifies the government's recognition and support for the medical professionals who have been diligently working on the front lines of the health crisis.
